originalText.text: I worked with Connor and Dustin throughout my experience with PhysioRX and they were so great! I came to them, fresh off of a number of ankle injuries on both sides that needed surgery. However, as a Taekwondo athlete that needed to return to the international competition scene ASAP, both of them were extremely helpful in helping me get back to competition level both physically and mentally. Thanks to their help, I was able to return to the competition scene and come away with a bronze medal at the 2023 Chengdu Summer World Games! Their back-to -the-fundamentals approach to strength training and conditioning truly pushed me to progress past even my pre-injury strength levels.

originalText.text:
For five years, I struggled with shoulder injuries from overtraining on the bench press, trying various treatments such as intense sports massage therapy and stretching with no success. I contemplated seeing an orthopedic doctor for potential surgery for years, but the high costs deterred me. I felt defeated and eventually avoided all horizontal pressing movements. As a last ditch effort, I discovered PhysioRX and decided to give them a try.

I worked with the PhysioRX team of Will and Connor, exclusively through their app. Although in-person visits were an option, they assured me during my initial evaluation that it wasn't necessary, saving me both time and money.

In the app, they created a comprehensive workout plan, tailored to my schedule and goals and included regular check-ins. Whenever I had questions about anything, they were just a quick text away.

After 6 months of dedication, my shoulders are now fully functional, and I am back bench pressing for the first time in 5 years. Additionally, they taught me several science-based techniques and methodologies about load management to ensure a sustainable and long-term weightlifting career.

With any luck, I won't have any injuries in the future, but if I do, I will call PhysioRX. Thank you, Will and Connor, for your support and expertise! You guys have changed my fitness journey forever.

originalText.text: They are amazing. I worked with Connor Cronan for 6 months and his dedication to helping me start lifting weights and his ability to motivate me in combination with his impressive knowledge made my journey so wonderful. I will miss the weekly check-ins and the continuous support.

text.text: They are amazing. I worked with Connor Cronan for 6 months and his dedication to helping me start lifting weights and his ability to motivate me in combination with his impressive knowledge made my journey so wonderful. I will miss the weekly check-ins and the continuous support.

originalText.text: After years of soccer, CrossFit, and a resulting knee injury, I came to PhysioRx with multiple areas of pain. I didn’t want to give up my fitness, but needed guidance. PhysioRX became my perfect solution. After an initial consult, I was paired up with Connor and Alex, who helped me return to a consistent weight training and cardio routine (specifically evening out a persistently imbalanced squat!). They are super responsive, check in regularly and are quick to make changes to work outs based on my needs. They’re very knowledgeable and clearly very skilled in what they do. As a “Master’s athlete” it’s comforting to know I’m working with trainers who are also DPTs. Thanks guys, I plan on sticking around for a while!!

originalText.text: I started going to PhysioRx after I tore left acl which is 7 years after I tore my right acl, both playing soccer. After tearing it for the 2nd time, I realized I needed specialized care instead of a generic PT location so I decided to try out PhysioRX, and they have been amazing! I work with Will mostly and even though I only see him once a month and the rest virtually, I have seen so much more progress than my first acl tear. Will is up to date with the most recent research which makes him super knowledgable and trustworthy. He busts a bunch of gym/strength conditioning myths for me and really teaches me how to focus on the movements. PhysioRx is out of network but I think it's well-worth it especially to prevent any further injuries! I feel stronger and hope to be stronger than I was pre-injury!
